meanings.definition: a device used to slow the descent of a person or object through the air by creating drag
meanings.sent1: The parachute opened smoothly, gently lowering the skydiver to the ground.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check your parachute before skydiving to ensure a safe landing.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy penguin tried to use a parachute made of leaves to glide down the icy slope.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a parachute, breaking his fall from a bad day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parachute billowed in the wind, a beautiful sight against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: to jump from an aircraft using a parachute
meanings.sent1: I will parachute from the plane during the training exercise.
meanings.sent2: They decided to parachute over the scenic valley for an adrenaline rush.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel wanted to parachute from the tree branch with a tiny leaf.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job felt like a leap to parachute into the unknown.
meanings.sent5: With a whoosh, he dared to parachute into the sea of possibilities.

meanings.sent1: We will parachute down to the designated landing zone.
meanings.sent2: The team had to parachute into the jungle for their mission.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to parachute from the top of the bookshelf, landing gracefully on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams seemed to parachute from the stars, gently guiding her to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The golden leaves parachute down from the autumn trees, painting the ground in hues of orange.
